Event.name: Trial
Event.definition: <def-root>A trial is a process conducted in a <fen>Court</fen> before a <fen>Judge</fen> and (usually) a <fen>Jury</fen> in which the participants meet in order to decide a <fen>Case</fen>. The <fen>Prosecution</fen> attempts to prove that the <fen>Defendant</fen> is guilty of the <fen>Charges</fen> and the <fen>Defense</fen> tries to prove that the <fen>Defendant</fen> is innocent. Trials have a rich schematic structure which is only partially represented here. The Trial frame is the part of the Criminal Process frame that occurs after a crime, Arrest of a suspect, Arraignment, jury selection, etc. and before Sentencing and punishment or release. The Trial is made up of court appearances. The beginning of the Trial generally involves opening arguments, in which the <fen>Prosecution</fen> and the <fen>Defense</fen> present their respective points of view. Then during the course of the Trial, both sides present evidence, some of which is provided by witnesses with testimony, and this is then drawn upon as support for their arguments. Following the presentation of evidence, testimony, and arguments, generally culminating in closing arguments for each side, the <fen>Jury</fen> (if present) deliberates and either comes to no sufficient consensus or produces a Verdict.</def-root>

Arg.name: Charges
Arg.definition: <def-root>The legal label for the crime that the <fen>Defendant</fen> is accused of.</def-root>

Arg.name: Court
Arg.definition: <def-root>The specific room where the participants in a Trial meet.</def-root>

Arg.name: Defense
Arg.definition: <def-root>The individual or group which is responsible for promoting the welfare of the <fen>Defendant</fen> during a Trial, usually involving the contention that the <fen>Defendant</fen> is innocent of the <fen>Charges</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Jury
Arg.definition: <def-root>The group of individuals who observe the Trial and ultimately attempt to come to a verdict.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the trial occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Prosecution
Arg.definition: <def-root>The individual or group responsible for promoting the interests of the state in the Trial, prototypically including presenting arguments for the guilt of the <fen>Defendant</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the trial occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Judge
Arg.definition: <def-root>The official who directs and presides over the Trial.</def-root>

Arg.name: Case
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Case</fen> which a Trial is convened to decide. </def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>The way in which the Trial is conducted. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: trial.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a formal examination of evidence in order to decide guilt in a case of criminal or civil proceedings.

lexUnit.name: case.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an incident under official investigation by the police, or a legal action, especially one that is to be decided in a court of law, or a legal action that has been decided and may be cited as a precedent.
